intro: Diplostephium frontinense, commonly known as the Brazilian burr, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny fruit heads. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by the development of dry, woody fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in open areas with well-drained soil. Due to its unique morphology, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
